text:
When I change the content of a web page, Tomcat 
still serves up an *old* version of the page.  I have 
rebooted both the web server and out client pc's many times 
and Tomcat still serves up the old page.  I have verified 
that it is not the browser caching the old page because 
I went to another pc to test from there also.

This is a critical problem that has stopped all our 
development from continuing.

David
dpotter@technologysciences.com
816-340-7032
818-415-9596
creator: dev@tomcat.apache.org

text:
You probably have a proxy server ( maybe a transparent one ). It's almost impossible for tomcat to remember an old page ( unless it's a JSP and the date 
on the system is broken - so it can't detect the change and recompile, in which case you either fix the date or remove the work dir )
creator: cmanolache@yahoo.com
